sources.title: Marked Men (1940)
sources.description: A man accused of planning a prison break turns the tables on escaped cons by leading the group into the desert. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/marked-men-1940/

sources.title: Marked Men (1940) | Colorized Public Domain Crime Drama with Warren Hull & Isabel Jewell
sources.description:
Marked Men (1940) is an American crime-drama film directed by Sam Newfield, starring Warren Hull, Isabel Jewell, and John Dilson. Restored and colorized for modern audiences, this public domain classic tells a story of injustice, desert survival, and ultimate redemption. By breathing new life into the original black-and-white release, this edition offers a vivid experience for viewers in the United States, Europe, and across the world who want to rediscover forgotten Hollywood gems.

Plot Summary:
Bill Carver is framed for a crime he did not commit by gangster Joe Mallon. Wrongfully imprisoned, Bill is caught in a prison escape attempt gone wrong, forcing him to flee into the harsh Arizona desert. With only a stray dog he names Wolf by his side, Bill seeks refuge in the town of Tempe. There, Dr. James Prentiss Harkness and his daughter Linda give him shelter, work, and trust. For a moment, Bill finds peace, but Mallon and his gang soon escape as well, staging a bank robbery and leaving Bill falsely accused once again. Determined to clear his name, Bill hunts down the criminals through blistering desert landscapes. One by one, Mallonâ€™s men collapse in the unforgiving terrain, until only Bill, Mallon, and Wolf remain. With courage and loyalty on his side, Bill forces a confession from Mallon and is finally exonerated. Justice restored, Bill marries Linda and begins a new chapter in freedom.

Cast and Crew:

â€¢ Producer: Sigmund Neufeld
â€¢ Writers: Harold Greene, George Bricker
â€¢ Cinematography: Jack Greenhalgh
â€¢ Editing: Holbrook N. Todd

Starring:
â€¢ Warren Hull as Bill Carver
â€¢ Isabel Jewell as Linda Harkness
â€¢ John Dilson as Dr. James Prentiss Harkness
â€¢ Paul Bryar as Joe Mallon
â€¢ Charles Williams as Charlie Sloane
â€¢ Lyle Clement as Marshal Dan Tait
â€¢ Budd Buster as Mr. Marvin
â€¢ Al St. John as Gimpy
â€¢ Eddie Fetherston as Marty
â€¢ Ted Erwin as Mike
â€¢ Art Miles as Blimp
â€¢ Grey Shadow as Wolf the Dog

Film Details:
â€¢ Release Year: 1940
â€¢ Runtime: 66 minutes
â€¢ Country: United States
â€¢ Language: English
â€¢ Alternate Title: Desert Escape

Film Significance:
Marked Men stands out as a striking example of early 1940s B-movie storytelling. Compact, gritty, and emotionally charged, it combines wrongful imprisonment with desert survival, reflecting themes of justice, redemption, and loyalty. Director Sam Newfield was one of Hollywoodâ€™s most prolific filmmakers, known for his ability to craft tight and engaging stories on modest budgets. Isabel Jewellâ€™s performance adds heart to the story, while Warren Hull delivers intensity as a man fighting against false accusations. The inclusion of Wolf the dog as a loyal companion deepens the emotional impact, symbolizing resilience and loyalty against overwhelming odds.

Enhanced Public Domain Explanation:
This film is in the public domain, which means it is completely free of copyright restrictions and can be legally shared, viewed, studied, and preserved without limitation. Colorized Public Domain restores and enhances these historic works through careful digital cleaning, visual restoration, and colorization techniques. Our mission is to ensure that timeless classics like Marked Men remain available to a worldwide audience. By presenting them in color and modern quality, we make them more engaging and accessible to younger generations who might otherwise overlook black-and-white cinema. This process respects the original film while providing a new layer of appreciation for todayâ€™s viewers.

Why Watch This Colorized Edition:
The 1940 original was released in black and white, a common choice for low-budget studios of the era. While historically authentic, many modern viewers overlook black-and-white films. By restoring and colorizing Marked Men, this edition highlights the suspense of the desert pursuit, the harsh landscapes, and the intensity of the characters. The colorization not only enhances the visual experience but also bridges the gap between historical preservation and contemporary viewing habits, making the story of Bill Carver more engaging to todayâ€™s audiences.

Our work ensures these treasures remain discoverable, enjoyable, and preserved for audiences in the USA, Europe, and worldwide.

sources.title: Marked Men (1940) American Western film directed by Sam Newfield
sources.description:
Framed for a crime he didnâ€™t commit, Bill Carver escapes a failed prison break and finds refuge in a desert townâ€”until a gang of fugitives forces him into a treacherous journey across the sands. Armed with grit, a loyal dog named Wolf, and a burning need to clear his name, Bill must outwit ruthless criminals and survive the merciless wilderness. Itâ€™s a gripping tale of justice, redemption, and survival against all odds.

metadata.Plot: Bill Carver is a young medical-school graduate wrongly confined in prison. He escapes and finds a haven and romance in an Arizona small town. But his hopes of happiness and freedom are dashed when gangster Joe Mallon and his four henchmen show up. Mallon was the one who engineered Bill into the frame-up felony that sent him to prison along with Mallon. Bill is forced to lead Mallon and his men into an escape attempt across the blistering, sun-scorched desert.
metadata.Actors: Warren Hull, Isabel Jewell, John Dilson
